title: Prompt Kit: Product-Led Growth Funnel Designer
prompt:
You are a SaaS growth strategist. Using the Product-Led Growth (PLG) model, design a funnel for converting users from free trial to paid for [SAAS PRODUCT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about user behavior data, pricing model, and product milestones.
2.	Funnel Stages: Define Awareness, Activation, Retention, Referral, and Revenue stages with key metrics.
3.	Triggers: Suggest 2 triggers per stage that signal readiness to move forward.
4.	Optimization Ideas: Recommend 2 experiments per stage to improve conversion.
idealUseCase: SaaS teams optimizing trial-to-paid conversion with user behavior insights.

title: Prompt Kit: AI-Powered Resume Refiner
prompt:
You are a career coach with expertise in ATS-optimized resumes. Improve this resume to increase interview chances for [ROLE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about target job description, achievements, and industry keywords.
2.	Keyword Match: Identify and include 5 high-impact keywords from the job description.
3.	Rewrite: Revise summary, experience bullets, and skills for clarity, impact, and ATS compliance.
4.	Format Advice: Suggest 3 tips to improve structure and readability.
idealUseCase: Job seekers refining resumes for better applicant tracking system performance.

title: Prompt Kit: Webinar Funnel Content Builder
prompt:
You are a digital marketing funnel strategist. Using the Before-After-Bridge (BAB) framework, create a 3-email webinar funnel for [WEBINAR TOPIC]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about the target audience, webinar benefits, and objections.
2.	Email Sequence: Write 3 emails using BAB: Invitation, Reminder, and Last Chance.
3.	CTAs: Suggest 2 different CTA options for each email.
4.	Objection Handling: Include one sentence addressing common objection in each email.
idealUseCase: Marketers promoting high-conversion webinars through email.

title: Prompt Kit: Customer Journey Map Illustrator
prompt:
You are a UX researcher. Using empathy mapping and journey stages, build a customer journey map for [CUSTOMER TYPE] interacting with [PRODUCT/SERVICE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 3 questions about persona pain points, emotional states, and engagement points.
2.	Stages: Define 5 journey stages with actions, thoughts, and feelings.
3.	Opportunities: Highlight 3 UX improvement opportunities.
4.	Visualization: Provide an ASCII or markdown-style journey table.
idealUseCase: Product and design teams mapping user experience and pain points.

title: Prompt Kit: Product Launch Countdown Planner
prompt:
You are a launch marketing manager. Using the 30-60-90 day launch model, plan a go-to-market strategy for [PRODUCT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about launch assets, team size, and sales channels.
2.	Timeline: Break down activities into 30, 60, and 90-day milestones.
3.	Channels: Suggest 3 marketing channels for each phase.
4.	KPIs: Recommend 2 KPIs per phase to track progress.
idealUseCase: Founders and marketers launching new products with structured timelines.

title: Prompt Kit: LinkedIn Thought Leader Post Generator
prompt:
You are a B2B content strategist. Using the Hook-Insight-Engagement format, write a high-performing LinkedIn post on [TOPIC]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 2 questions about target audience and core insight.
2.	Structure: Craft a scroll-stopping hook, personal insight story, and comment-prompting CTA.
3.	Hashtags: Suggest 5 niche hashtags for reach.
4.	Variant: Offer one alternative post angle.
idealUseCase: Professionals building visibility and engagement on LinkedIn.

title: Prompt Kit: Community Engagement Strategy Builder
prompt:
You are a community manager. Using the Engagement Pyramid model, craft a 4-level member engagement plan for [COMMUNITY]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 2 questions about member motivations and platform type.
2.	Levels: Define Observer, Participant, Contributor, and Advocate roles.
3.	Activities: Suggest 2 engagement activities per level.
4.	Metrics: Recommend one success metric per level.
idealUseCase: Community builders increasing member participation and advocacy.

title: Prompt Kit: Investor One-Pager Generator
prompt:
You are a venture analyst. Using the Problem-Solution-Market-Traction-Financials framework, create a startup one-pager for [STARTUP NAME]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about market size and revenue model.
2.	Structure: Fill out each section with concise, investor-friendly language.
3.	Highlight: Bold one key traction stat.
4.	CTA: Suggest 2 next-step CTAs for investors.
idealUseCase: Startups preparing for early investor conversations.

title: Prompt Kit: Niche Product Positioning Canvas
prompt:
You are a product marketer. Using the Positioning Statement formula, define the unique positioning for [NICHE PRODUCT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 2 questions about competitors and value propositions.
2.	Formula: For [Target], who [Need], [Product] is a [Category] that [Benefit]. Unlike [Competitor], it [Differentiator].
3.	Variation: Provide a version for web headline copy.
4.	Visual: Suggest a 3-part graphic concept to support this.
idealUseCase: Teams crafting distinct product positioning for marketing and sales alignment.

title: Prompt Kit: Feature Launch Announcement Writer
prompt:
You are a SaaS copywriter. Using the FAB formula (Feature-Advantage-Benefit), write a product update email for [FEATURE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 2 questions about user pain points and usage context.
2.	Email Copy: Include subject line, intro paragraph, FAB section, and CTA.
3.	Tone Option: Suggest a casual and a formal rewrite.
4.	Metrics: Recommend 2 metrics to track engagement.
idealUseCase: Product teams announcing updates with persuasive copy that drives adoption.

title: Prompt Kit: Mobile App Retention Strategist
prompt:
You are a mobile growth expert. Using the AARRR framework, create a retention strategy for [MOBILE APP]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about user cohorts, churn triggers, and retention goals.
2.	Data Snapshot: Define key retention metrics across day 1, 7, and 30.
3.	Interventions: Suggest 3 tactics to reduce churn (e.g., push notifications, onboarding improvements).
4.	Lifecycle Hooks: Identify 2 features or moments to create habit loops.
idealUseCase: Mobile product teams aiming to improve active user retention.

title: Prompt Kit: Sales Enablement Asset Generator
prompt:
You are a B2B sales enablement strategist. Using the Problem-Agitate-Solution format, create a one-pager for [SALES REP USE CASE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about customer objections, product value, and sales stage.
2.	Messaging: Craft a PAS message including customer pain, tension, and solution.
3.	Visuals: Recommend 2 graphic ideas to support the pitch.
4.	Distribution: Suggest 2 formats (e.g., PDF, Slide) and one usage tip.
idealUseCase: Enablement teams building tools to empower sales conversations.

title: Prompt Kit: Social Media Brand Audit Coach
prompt:
You are a social brand strategist. Using the 5Cs (Content, Consistency, Community, Channel Fit, and Conversion), audit [SOCIAL PROFILE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 2 questions about goals and competitors.
2.	Audit: Provide 2 insights per C with examples.
3.	Score: Rate each C on a 1–5 scale with justification.
4.	Recommendations: Suggest 3 high-impact next steps.
idealUseCase: Social media managers improving profile performance.

title: Prompt Kit: User Research Interview Guide Creator
prompt:
You are a UX researcher. Design a 30-minute user interview script for [FEATURE/PROBLEM]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about the research goal and persona.
2.	Intro: Write a 2-minute opening to explain purpose and consent.
3.	Questions: Draft 8 open-ended interview questions.
4.	Wrap-Up: Provide 2 closing questions and 1 thank-you script.
idealUseCase: Designers and PMs preparing to talk to real users.

title: Prompt Kit: Pricing Page Conversion Optimizer
prompt:
You are a CRO expert. Using behavioral economics principles, optimize the pricing page for [PRODUCT/SERVICE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about price tiers and visitor traffic sources.
2.	Psychology Levers: Apply 3 levers (anchoring, scarcity, social proof).
3.	Copy: Suggest headline and CTA revisions.
4.	Test Ideas: Recommend 2 A/B tests to run.
idealUseCase: Teams increasing pricing page conversions with behavioral insights.

title: Prompt Kit: Technical Onboarding Docs Creator
prompt:
You are a technical writer. Using onboarding best practices, draft a quick-start guide for [API/TOOL]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 2 questions about user skill level and setup flow.
2.	Overview: Write a 3-sentence description of purpose and value.
3.	Steps: Create a numbered list of 5–7 steps to get started.
4.	Support: Add 2 troubleshooting tips and 1 link to extended docs.
idealUseCase: Developer experience teams improving user onboarding.

title: Prompt Kit: Change Management Communication Plan
prompt:
You are an internal communications strategist. Using the Kotter 8-Step Change model, plan a communication rollout for [CHANGE INITIATIVE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about internal culture and urgency.
2.	Timeline: Map messages to each of the 8 steps.
3.	Channels: Recommend a comms channel per step.
4.	Resistance Plan: Suggest 3 ways to manage internal pushback.
idealUseCase: HR and comms teams guiding organizations through transitions.

title: Prompt Kit: Interactive Product Tour Scriptwriter
prompt:
You are a product education specialist. Using the Show-Explain-Ask model, script an in-app onboarding tour for [FEATURE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about feature value and user stage.
2.	Tour Stops: Write 4 tour messages with tooltips or modals.
3.	Interaction: Suggest one user input per stop (click, confirm).
4.	CTA: End with a success message and next step.
idealUseCase: SaaS teams designing in-product education flows.

title: Prompt Kit: Audience Persona Profile Creator
prompt:
You are a brand strategist. Using Jobs-to-Be-Done (JTBD), draft a persona profile for [AUDIENCE TYPE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about user goals and frustrations.
2.	JTBD Profile: Fill in functional, emotional, and social jobs.
3.	Quotes: Add 3 first-person statements that reflect user voice.
4.	Summary: Write a paragraph persona overview.
idealUseCase: Marketing and product teams defining audience archetypes.

title: Prompt Kit: Content Repurposing Strategist
prompt:
You are a content marketing strategist. Using the Core-to-Micro framework, turn a long-form article on [TOPIC] into a week of social content:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about article goals and audience platform.
2.	Core Summary: Rewrite key takeaways in <100 words.
3.	Micro Pieces: Suggest 5 formats (e.g., carousel, tweet thread, reel) with caption drafts.
4.	CTA: Add a suggested CTA for each.
idealUseCase: Content teams extracting more value from existing long-form content.

title: Prompt Kit: Product Demo Script Engineer
prompt:
You are a sales engineer. Using the Problem-Solution-Proof format, script a 5-minute demo for [PRODUCT FEATURE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 2 questions about target audience and main challenge.
2.	Flow: Outline intro, feature walkthrough, benefit, and proof.
3.	Visual Support: Suggest 3 slides or screen highlights.
4.	Follow-Up: Include one closing line and next step CTA.
idealUseCase: Sales or CS teams creating focused, benefit-driven demos.

title: Prompt Kit: Pre-Mortem Risk Planning Facilitator
prompt:
You are a project risk facilitator. Using pre-mortem analysis, uncover potential failure points for [INITIATIVE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about timeline and critical dependencies.
2.	Scenario: Describe the “project failure” scenario in 3 sentences.
3.	Root Causes: Identify 5 likely failure contributors.
4.	Preventive Actions: Recommend 2 actions per risk.
idealUseCase: Project leaders proactively addressing risk before kickoff.

title: Prompt Kit: Executive Summary Synthesizer
prompt:
You are a business analyst. Summarize a full report on [TOPIC] into an executive summary:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about audience and use case.
2.	Summary: Write a 3-paragraph summary (Problem, Analysis, Recommendation).
3.	Key Points: List 5 critical insights or metrics.
4.	Style: Suggest a tone (e.g., formal, persuasive) and adjust summary.
idealUseCase: Busy execs needing high-level comprehension of detailed documents.

title: Prompt Kit: On-Site Event Experience Designer
prompt:
You are an event producer. Design an attendee journey for [EVENT TYPE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about audience and venue setup.
2.	Journey Stages: Describe Welcome, Main Event, and Exit phases.
3.	Touchpoints: Suggest 3 engagement elements per stage.
4.	Measurement: Recommend 3 metrics to assess experience.
idealUseCase: Teams curating immersive, engaging in-person events.

title: Prompt Kit: Brand Origin Story Writer
prompt:
You are a brand storyteller. Using the Founder's Journey narrative arc, write a brand origin story for [BRAND]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about founder background and mission.
2.	Structure: Write Hook, Challenge, Breakthrough, and Legacy sections.
3.	Emotional Levers: Identify 3 emotions to tap into (e.g., grit, vision).
4.	CTA: Suggest a soft CTA to close (e.g., “Join us”).
idealUseCase: Founders and marketers building an emotional brand connection.

title: Prompt Kit: Customer Win Story Draftsman
prompt:
You are a case study writer. Create a customer success story using the Before-During-After framework for [CLIENT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 3 questions about the client’s goals, solution, and results.
2.	Draft: Write 3 sections: Before (challenge), During (implementation), After (outcome).
3.	Quote: Include one testimonial sentence.
4.	Format Tips: Recommend layout/format (e.g., PDF, slide, social post).
idealUseCase: Marketers and CS teams showcasing real customer success.

title: Prompt Kit: Digital Product Feedback Collector
prompt:
You are a product researcher. Design an in-app survey to gather feedback on [FEATURE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about user base and survey goals.
2.	Questions: Write 5 targeted questions (Likert, open-text, multiple choice).
3.	Timing: Suggest 2 triggering moments to launch survey.
4.	Analysis Plan: Recommend how to segment and act on data.
idealUseCase: Product teams validating new features or UX changes.

title: Prompt Kit: Partner Onboarding Journey Designer
prompt:
You are a partner program strategist. Build a 4-week onboarding journey for [PARTNER TYPE]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about partner goals and business model.
2.	Phases: Outline weekly themes with goals and tasks.
3.	Content: Recommend 2 resources per week (deck, video, form).
4.	Checkpoints: Suggest 3 progress check milestones.
idealUseCase: Partnership teams enabling high-performing, well-supported partners.

title: Prompt Kit: Referral Program Architect
prompt:
You are a growth marketer. Design a referral program for [PRODUCT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about user incentives and current channels.
2.	Mechanics: Define how the program works in 3 steps.
3.	Messaging: Suggest 2 tagline options and one CTA.
4.	Metrics: Recommend 3 KPIs to measure success.
idealUseCase: Businesses aiming to grow via word-of-mouth and incentives.

title: Prompt Kit: AI Ethics Risk Assessor
prompt:
You are an AI governance expert. Evaluate potential ethical risks for [AI APPLICATION]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about use context and user impact.
2.	Risk Types: List 4 categories (e.g., bias, privacy, transparency, accountability) with 1 risk each.
3.	Mitigations: Suggest 1 preventive action per risk.
4.	Review Plan: Recommend 2 stakeholder review checkpoints.
idealUseCase: AI teams preparing for responsible deployment and audits.

title: Prompt Kit: Visual Identity Style Guide Crafter
prompt:
You are a brand designer. Create a visual identity guide for [BRAND]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about tone and use cases.
2.	Core Elements: Define logo usage, color palette, and typography.
3.	Visual Do/Don't: Provide 2 visual misuse examples.
4.	Assets List: Suggest key downloadable items (e.g., logo files, templates).
idealUseCase: Design teams formalizing consistent brand visuals.

title: Prompt Kit: Technical Debt Review Assistant
prompt:
You are a software architect. Conduct a tech debt audit for [CODEBASE/PRODUCT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about architecture age and team velocity.
2.	Categories: List 4 areas (e.g., legacy code, test coverage, architecture, dependencies).
3.	Prioritization: Suggest a high/med/low scale with rationale.
4.	Remediation Plan: Outline 3 quick wins and 2 long-term fixes.
idealUseCase: Tech leads managing backlog and risk in complex systems.

title: Prompt Kit: User Onboarding Email Series Writer
prompt:
You are a lifecycle marketer. Write a 3-email onboarding series for [PRODUCT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about user behavior goals and tone.
2.	Sequence: Define Welcome, Activation, and Next Steps emails.
3.	Copy: Draft subject, preview text, body (~100 words), and CTA.
4.	Timing: Recommend ideal send schedule.
idealUseCase: Marketers improving activation through email onboarding.

title: Prompt Kit: Microcopy UX Advisor
prompt:
You are a UX writer. Improve microcopy for [INTERFACE ELEMENT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about user intent and tone.
2.	Rewrite: Suggest 3 options for microcopy (label, button, tooltip, etc.).
3.	Justification: Explain the user psychology behind each.
4.	Variant Test: Propose an A/B test idea.
idealUseCase: Designers crafting frictionless, human-centered interactions.

title: Prompt Kit: Webinar Slide Deck Storyboarder
prompt:
You are a presentation coach. Draft a 10-slide deck outline for [WEBINAR TOPIC]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about audience and key transformation.
2.	Slide Titles: List 10 titles with slide purpose.
3.	Visual Cues: Recommend a visual for each slide.
4.	CTA: Write final slide text and CTA.
idealUseCase: Experts packaging ideas for compelling online webinars.

title: Prompt Kit: Brand Partnership Outreach Script
prompt:
You are a BD representative. Write an outreach message to pitch a co-marketing campaign with [BRAND]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about brand fit and offer.
2.	Message: Include subject, opener, value prop, mutual benefit, CTA.
3.	Variant: Write a casual tone version.
4.	Follow-Up: Provide 1 reminder message.
idealUseCase: Marketing and partnership teams proposing collaborations.

title: Prompt Kit: Live Chat Script Improver
prompt:
You are a conversation design expert. Improve a live chat support flow for [TOPIC]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about customer tone and resolution goals.
2.	Rewrite: Suggest 3 responses that reduce friction.
3.	Tone Tip: Recommend a phrase to soften or personalize tone.
4.	Escalation Cue: Provide 1 trigger for agent handoff.
idealUseCase: Support teams improving speed and satisfaction in live chat.

title: Prompt Kit: API Documentation Draft Assistant
prompt:
You are a developer advocate. Draft clean API docs for [ENDPOINT/FUNCTION]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about users and use case.
2.	Structure: Write description, method, parameters, example, response.
3.	Style Tips: Suggest 2 formatting improvements.
4.	Use Case: Provide 1 usage example.
idealUseCase: Technical teams improving onboarding through better documentation.

title: Prompt Kit: Customer Objection Handling Trainer
prompt:
You are a sales coach. Write objection-handling scripts for [SALES OBJECTION]:
1.	Clarify: Ask 2 questions about context and buyer persona.
2.	Scripts: Write 3 short rebuttals using empathy + value framing.
3.	Close: Provide a confidence-building close.
4.	Variant: Offer one non-verbal tactic (e.g., pause, tone shift).
idealUseCase: Sales teams increasing win rates with effective objection handling.

title: Prompt Kit: Community Crisis Response Playbook
prompt:
You are a community‑management strategist. Build a rapid‑response playbook for local or online communities facing a reputational or safety crisis:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about community size, crisis type, and stakeholder concerns.
2.	Action Plan: Outline a 4‑phase response (Assess, Communicate, Contain, Rebuild) with concrete tasks.
3.	Comms Templates: Provide 2 example statements (internal & public).
4.	KPIs: List 3 metrics for post‑crisis recovery.
idealUseCase: Community managers or moderators who need an off‑the‑shelf crisis plan.

title: Prompt Kit: Voice of Customer Survey Analyzer
prompt:
You are a CX analyst. Turn raw Voice‑of‑Customer survey data into actionable insights:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about audience segment, survey scale, and time frame.
2.	Theme Extraction: Show a 4‑step process to cluster feedback into themes.
3.	Priority Matrix: Create a 2×2 matrix (Impact vs. Effort) with at least 4 example insights.
4.	Next Steps: Recommend 3 follow‑up research methods.
idealUseCase: CX teams summarizing NPS or CSAT comments for exec read‑outs.

title: Prompt Kit: Competitive Differentiation Matrix Builder
prompt:
You are a product‑marketing strategist. Build a differentiation matrix that highlights [PRODUCT] against top 3 competitors:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about key competitors, differentiators, and buyer personas.
2.	Matrix: Draft a 4‑column table (Feature, Our Strength, Competitor Gap, Proof Point).
3.	Message Angles: Suggest 3 positioning taglines.
4.	Risk Check: List 2 watch‑outs for claims accuracy.
idealUseCase: PMMs crafting launch decks or sales battlecards.

title: Prompt Kit: SaaS Trial Activation Optimizer
prompt:
You are a growth marketer. Design a 3‑touch activation flow for a 14‑day SaaS trial:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about ICP, aha moment, and activation metric.
2.	Email + In‑App Sequence: Map 3 timed nudges (day 0, 3, 10) with headline and CTA.
3.	Objection Handling: Add one sentence tackling ‘too busy’ objection each time.
4.	Success Metric: Propose 2 ways to measure lift.
idealUseCase: Growth teams increasing trial‑to‑paid conversions.

title: Prompt Kit: Annual Report Key Message Synthesizer
prompt:
You are a corporate‑comms editor. Distill a 100‑page annual report into 5 key messages and talking points:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about audience, top accomplishments, and sensitive areas.
2.	Key Messages: Produce 5 headlines with 2‑sentence elaborations.
3.	Proof Points: Suggest 2 data points or quotes for each message.
4.	Media Soundbites: Write one <140‑char quote for social.
idealUseCase: IR or PR teams prepping execs for interviews.

title: Prompt Kit: AI‑Driven Product Backlog Prioritizer
prompt:
You are an agile product coach. Prioritize backlog items with the RICE model:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about reach assumptions, confidence threshold, and resources.
2.	RICE Table: Show sample scoring for 5 items.
3.	Scenario Twist: Demonstrate how one score shift changes priority order.
4.	Next Sprint Plan: Recommend 3 top items and rationale.
idealUseCase: Product owners needing a quick RICE walkthrough for stakeholders.

title: Prompt Kit: Localization Readiness Checklist Creator
prompt:
You are a localization program manager. Create a readiness checklist before translating a SaaS UI:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about target locales, string storage, and brand voice.
2.	Checklist: Provide 10 yes/no items across Content, Design, Legal.
3.	Risk Flags: Highlight 3 common blockers.
4.	KPIs: Suggest 2 metrics to track post‑launch quality.
idealUseCase: Teams expanding from single‑language to multi‑locale support.

title: Prompt Kit: Podcast Episode Outline Generator
prompt:
You are a podcast producer. Draft an outline for a 30‑minute episode on [TOPIC]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about target listener, guest expertise, and key takeaway.
2.	Segment Breakdown: Provide 4 segments with timestamps.
3.	Hook Ideas: Suggest 2 cold‑open lines.
4.	Promo CTA: Recommend 2 actions for listeners.
idealUseCase: Creators who need a fast, structured run‑of‑show.

title: Prompt Kit: Affiliate Marketing Offer Optimizer
prompt:
You are an affiliate‑program manager. Optimize a payout & messaging strategy:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about affiliate personas, average order value, and seasonality.
2.	Offer Matrix: Draft 3 tiers (Bronze/Silver/Gold) with commission %, bonus trigger, and pitch line.
3.	Recruiting Email: Provide 2 subject lines + body outline.
4.	KPI Forecast: Estimate revenue lift for each tier.
idealUseCase: E‑commerce brands scaling partner programs.

title: Prompt Kit: Brand Tone Consistency Checker
prompt:
You are a brand voice specialist. Audit copy snippets for tone consistency:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about tone attributes, banned words, and region variants.
2.	Audit Table: For 3 sample lines, label Tone Match (Y/N) and suggest rewrite.
3.	Guideline Extract: Summarize top 3 tone principles.
4.	Training Tip: Recommend 2 ways to onboard writers.
idealUseCase: Content teams harmonizing multi‑author assets.

title: Prompt Kit: Churn Prediction Email Series Writer
prompt:
You are a lifecycle marketer. Craft a 2‑email save sequence for users with churn risk score >80%:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about churn drivers, offer levers, and segment.
2.	Emails: Write Subject + 3‑paragraph body for Save 1 (Value Reminder) and Save 2 (Personal Touch).
3.	CTA Options: Provide 2 offers per email.
4.	Urgency Line: Include one FOMO sentence each.
idealUseCase: Subscription businesses reducing voluntary churn.

title: Prompt Kit: CSR Impact Storyboard Designer
prompt:
You are a CSR storyteller. Turn program results into a 6‑slide impact storyboard:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about initiative type, beneficiaries, and headline stat.
2.	Slide Outline: Give titles and bullet points for 6 slides.
3.	Visual Cues: Suggest 2 image ideas per slide.
4.	Call‑to‑Action: End with 2 ways audience can get involved.
idealUseCase: CSR teams preparing board or employee updates.

title: Prompt Kit: Digital Accessibility Audit Guide
prompt:
You are an accessibility consultant. Produce a WCAG 2.2 quick‑audit guide:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about site type, user agents, and known issues.
2.	Checklist: Provide 8 critical audit items (perceivable, operable, understandable, robust).
3.	Tool Links: Recommend 3 free testing tools.
4.	Quick Wins: Highlight 2 fixes achievable in <1 day.
idealUseCase: Product or web teams starting accessibility work.

title: Prompt Kit: Fintech Compliance Checklist Architect
prompt:
You are a fintech compliance officer. Build a pre‑launch checklist for a new payment feature:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about jurisdiction, transaction volume, and user KYC status.
2.	Checklist: List 10 items across AML, PSD2, PCI‑DSS.
3.	Risk Heatmap: Flag 3 high‑risk areas.
4.	Documentation Links: Suggest 2 reference regs.
idealUseCase: Fintech PMs aligning with legal before release.

title: Prompt Kit: Event Sponsorship Pitch Creator
prompt:
You are an event marketer. Draft a sponsorship pitch deck outline for [EVENT]:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about sponsor profile, event audience, and value props.
2.	Deck Outline: List 8 slides with key bullets.
3.	Package Table: Provide 3 tiers with benefits.
4.	Closing CTA: Suggest 2 next‑step asks.
idealUseCase: Agencies wooing corporate sponsors for in‑person or virtual events.

title: Prompt Kit: Early Adopter Outreach Planner
prompt:
You are a product‑led growth strategist. Plan an outreach campaign to recruit 50 early adopters:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about ICP, value hypothesis, and incentive.
2.	Channel Mix: Recommend 3 channels with sample messages.
3.	Timeline: Create a 2‑week calendar.
4.	Success Metrics: List 3 KPIs (opt‑in %, feedback rate, NPS).
idealUseCase: Startups running a private beta or MVP test.

title: Prompt Kit: Employee Onboarding Buddy Script
prompt:
You are an HR enablement coach. Create a buddy‑program script for new hires’ first 30 days:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about company size, remote/hybrid context, and role type.
2.	Buddy Checklist: Provide 8 activities over 4 weeks.
3.	Conversation Prompts: Offer 5 icebreaker questions.
4.	Feedback Loop: Suggest 2 survey questions.
idealUseCase: HR teams standardizing peer‑buddy processes.

title: Prompt Kit: Gamified Loyalty Campaign Designer
prompt:
You are a loyalty strategist. Design a points‑plus‑badges campaign:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about customer lifecycle, reward budget, and mobile app presence.
2.	Game Loop: Describe core mechanic in 3 steps.
3.	Reward Ladder: Draft 3 badge tiers with perks.
4.	Engagement Metric: Recommend 2 ways to track lift.
idealUseCase: Retail or app marketers boosting repeat purchases.

title: Prompt Kit: Hardware Unboxing Experience Planner
prompt:
You are a D2C product designer. Craft an unboxing journey that sparks delight:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about brand story, packaging constraints, and sustainability goals.
2.	Unboxing Steps: Map 5 moments (visual + tactile).
3.	Insert Card Copy: Write 2 greeting card messages.
4.	Share Prompt: Suggest a social hashtag + incentive.
idealUseCase: Hardware startups aiming for viral unboxing videos.

title: Prompt Kit: Influencer Briefing Sheet Generator
prompt:
You are an influencer‑relations manager. Build a one‑pager brief for creators:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about platform, content style, and key deliverable.
2.	Brief Sections: Provide Goal, Do’s & Don’ts, Talking Points, and Deadlines.
3.	Compensation Table: Show 2 payment models.
4.	Tracking Link Setup: Outline UTM parameters.
idealUseCase: Brands sending standardized briefs to multiple influencers.

title: Prompt Kit: Internal Hackathon Agenda Architect
prompt:
You are an innovation facilitator. Create a 2‑day internal hackathon agenda:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about participant count, skill mix, and theme.
2.	Agenda Table: List sessions with start/end times.
3.	Judging Criteria: Provide 4 scoring categories.
4.	Prize Ideas: Suggest 3 reward types.
idealUseCase: Tech companies driving cross‑team innovation.

title: Prompt Kit: Knowledge Base Article Refiner
prompt:
You are a technical writer. Improve a draft KB article for clarity:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about target persona, reading level, and context.
2.	Rewrite Steps: Outline 4 edits (structure, active voice, screenshot placement, TL;DR).
3.	Style Check: Flag 3 jargon terms.
4.	Search Snippet: Produce a 160‑char meta description.
idealUseCase: Support teams reducing ticket volume through self‑service docs.

title: Prompt Kit: Landing Page Fold Analyzer
prompt:
You are a CRO specialist. Audit the above‑the‑fold section of a landing page:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about conversion goal, traffic source, and audience intent.
2.	Fold Elements: Score Headline, Visual, CTA, Social Proof (out of 5).
3.	Rapid Fixes: Provide 3 copy/design tweaks.
4.	Next Test: Suggest one A/B idea.
idealUseCase: Growth teams squeezing more value from paid traffic.

title: Prompt Kit: Marketplace Seller Success Playbook
prompt:
You are a marketplace success manager. Draft a playbook to onboard new third‑party sellers:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about vertical, average SKU count, and support level.
2.	Playbook Sections: Policies, Listing Optimization, Promotion, Analytics.
3.	Milestone Checklist: 5 tasks for first 30 days.
4.	FAQ Seeds: Provide 3 common seller questions.
idealUseCase: Two‑sided platforms scaling seller onboarding.

title: Prompt Kit: Media List Segmentation Wizard
prompt:
You are a PR strategist. Segment a master media list into 3 targeted sub‑lists:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about story angle, geography, and publication type.
2.	Segmentation Criteria: Outline 3 filters and give example outlets.
3.	Pitch Hook: Suggest 2 tailored hook lines per segment.
4.	Follow‑up Cadence: Recommend timing for 2 nudges.
idealUseCase: PR pros improving pitch relevancy and open rates.

title: Prompt Kit: Mentor‑Mentee Matchmaking Questionnaire
prompt:
You are a learning‑and‑development consultant. Create a matchmaking survey:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about program goal, seniority mix, and duration.
2.	Questionnaire: Craft 8 questions to capture skills & goals.
3.	Matching Logic: Describe a simple scoring formula.
4.	Kick‑off Email: Draft subject line + 2‑paragraph body.
idealUseCase: Companies launching formal mentorship programs.

title: Prompt Kit: Micro‑SaaS Launch Blueprint
prompt:
You are a solo‑founder coach. Build a 4‑week launch plan for a micro‑SaaS:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about niche audience, pricing, and channel budget.
2.	Week‑by‑Week Plan: List key tasks for Weeks 1‑4.
3.	Teaser Content: Provide 3 tweet‑length teasers.
4.	Feedback Loop: Suggest 2 early‑user survey questions.
idealUseCase: Indie hackers pushing an MVP to market quickly.

title: Prompt Kit: Nonprofit Grant Proposal Enhancer
prompt:
You are a nonprofit grantwriter. Strengthen a proposal narrative:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about funder priorities, program outcomes, and beneficiaries.
2.	Story Arc: Suggest a 3‑part structure (Need, Solution, Impact).
3.	Data Points: Recommend 3 compelling statistics.
4.	Executive Summary: Draft a 100‑word version.
idealUseCase: Small nonprofits competing for limited grants.

title: Prompt Kit: On‑Hold Messaging Scriptwriter
prompt:
You are a brand copywriter. Write a 45‑second on‑hold script:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about caller intent, brand tone, and cross‑sell priority.
2.	Script: Provide intro, value bullet, CTA, and friendly sign‑off.
3.	Music Cue: Suggest 2 royalty‑free genres.
4.	Legal Notice: Add one compliance line if needed.
idealUseCase: Contact centers reducing perceived wait time.

title: Prompt Kit: Open‑Source Contribution Roadmap
prompt:
You are an OSS community manager. Craft a roadmap for first‑time contributors:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about repo language, issue backlog, and Code of Conduct.
2.	Roadmap Steps: Identify Good First Issue, Setup, PR etiquette, Review.
3.	Recognition Ideas: List 3 contributor shout‑out tactics.
4.	Metrics: Propose 2 engagement KPIs.
idealUseCase: Maintainers lowering barriers to contribution.

title: Prompt Kit: Partner Integration GTM Kit
prompt:
You are a partner‑marketing lead. Build a GTM kit for a new tech integration:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about integration value prop, joint ICP, and launch tier.
2.	Asset Checklist: List 6 co‑branded assets (blog, webinar, battlecard, etc.).
3.	Timeline: Show 4 milestones from beta to GA.
4.	SLAs: Outline 2 mutual promotion commitments.
idealUseCase: ISVs launching marketplace or API integrations.

title: Prompt Kit: Performance Review Phrase Generator
prompt:
You are an HR coach. Generate balanced feedback phrases:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about role, competency, and example behavior.
2.	Strength Phrase: Provide 1 sentence acknowledging success.
3.	Growth Phrase: Provide 1 constructive sentence.
4.	Action Suggestion: Include a next‑step recommendation.
idealUseCase: Managers struggling with review wording.

title: Prompt Kit: Philanthropy Campaign Narrative Builder
prompt:
You are a fundraising storyteller. Build a 3‑part campaign narrative:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about cause, donor segment, and goal amount.
2.	Narrative Arc: Draft Hook, Story, Ask with 2‑sentence examples.
3.	Social Proof: Suggest 2 donor testimonials.
4.	Urgency Device: Provide one time‑sensitive angle.
idealUseCase: Development teams creating omnichannel appeals.

title: Prompt Kit: PR Crisis Simulation Facilitator
prompt:
You are a comms trainer. Design a tabletop exercise for PR crisis response:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about industry, scenario severity, and attendee roles.
2.	Scenario Cards: Provide 3 escalating events.
3.	Role Assignments: List 5 roles with objectives.
4.	Debrief Questions: Offer 4 reflection prompts.
idealUseCase: PR agencies conducting crisis preparedness workshops.

title: Prompt Kit: Product Adoption Gamification Planner
prompt:
You are a product‑growth strategist. Design a gamification flow that increases feature adoption:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about core action, user persona, and reward budget.
2.	Game Loop: Map Trigger, Action, Reward for 3 milestones.
3.	Reward Catalogue: List 3 badge / points combos.
4.	Success Metric: Suggest 2 KPIs (daily active %, stickiness).
idealUseCase: SaaS teams nudging users toward aha moments.

title: Prompt Kit: Progressive Web App Launch Kit
prompt:
You are a mobile‑web engineer. Outline a launch checklist for a new PWA:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about browsers, offline needs, and push strategy.
2.	Tech Checklist: Provide 8 items (manifest, service worker, Lighthouse score, etc.).
3.	Promo Plan: Suggest 3 marketing tactics.
4.	Post‑Launch KPIs: Recommend 2 metrics (install rate, TTI).
idealUseCase: Dev teams releasing PWA versions of existing sites.

title: Prompt Kit: Promotional Bundle Pricing Calculator
prompt:
You are a pricing analyst. Build a quick calculator to test bundle pricing:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about product mix, cost, and target margin.
2.	Bundle Matrix: Draft 3 bundles with price, discount %, and margin.
3.	Elasticity Check: Outline 2 ways to validate demand.
4.	Profit Guardrail: Suggest one rule to avoid cannibalization.
idealUseCase: E‑commerce managers running limited‑time bundles.

title: Prompt Kit: QA Test Case Idea Generator
prompt:
You are a QA lead. Generate test‑case ideas for a new feature:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about user stories, edge cases, and platforms.
2.	Test Table: Provide 5 cases with Steps, Expected, Priority.
3.	Automation Flag: Mark 2 cases suitable for automation.
4.	Bug Taxonomy: Suggest 2 categories to track.
idealUseCase: QA teams starting test design before coding ends.

title: Prompt Kit: Referral Email Sequence Designer
prompt:
You are a lifecycle marketer. Draft a 2‑email referral ask:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about incentive, customer segment, and timing.
2.	Emails: Provide Subject + 3‑paragraph body for Ask & Reminder.
3.	CTA Variations: Suggest 2 CTA wordings.
4.	Social Proof: Include one testimonial line per email.
idealUseCase: Startups turning happy customers into advocates.

title: Prompt Kit: Remote Work Culture Rituals Guide
prompt:
You are an organizational‑culture coach. Propose engaging rituals for remote teams:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about team size, time zones, and values.
2.	Ritual List: Provide 5 rituals with frequency and goal.
3.	Icebreaker Bank: Add 3 quick icebreaker ideas.
4.	Measurement: Suggest 2 pulse‑survey questions.
idealUseCase: Distributed teams boosting cohesion.

title: Prompt Kit: Retention Cohort Analysis Explainer
prompt:
You are a data analyst. Explain a retention cohort chart for execs:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about timeframe, metric, and segment.
2.	Explanation: Break down cohort heatmap in 3 points.
3.	Insight Highlights: Call out 2 unusual patterns.
4.	Next Actions: Recommend 2 retention experiments.
idealUseCase: Product leads presenting cohort data in reviews.

title: Prompt Kit: Sales Battlecard Draft Assistant
prompt:
You are a sales‑enablement writer. Draft a one‑page battlecard:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about persona, key competitor, and value prop.
2.	Sections: Headline, 3 Differentiators, Objection & Rebuttal, Proof Point.
3.	Pitch Line: Craft a 15‑word elevator pitch.
4.	Usage Tips: List 2 ways reps can leverage it.
idealUseCase: B2B sales teams prepping for competitive deals.

title: Prompt Kit: SEO Cannibalization Fixer
prompt:
You are an SEO specialist. Fix keyword cannibalization on a site:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about target keywords, CMS, and redirect policy.
2.	Audit Steps: Outline 4 tasks (crawl, map, merge, redirect).
3.	Action Table: Show 3 sample duplicate URLs with fix recommendation.
4.	Monitoring: Propose 2 ranking‑watch KPIs.
idealUseCase: Content teams cleaning up SEO issues before a relaunch.

title: Prompt Kit: Service Blueprint Mapper
prompt:
You are a service designer. Create a high‑level service blueprint:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about persona, touchpoints, and backstage systems.
2.	Blueprint Layers: List Frontstage, Backstage, Support for 3 customer steps.
3.	Pain Point Flags: Mark 2 critical gaps.
4.	Opportunity: Suggest one quick‑win improvement.
idealUseCase: CX teams visualizing complex service flows.

title: Prompt Kit: Shopper Psychology Trigger Card Deck
prompt:
You are a behavioral‑economics copywriter. Produce a card deck of persuasion triggers:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about product category, audience, and channel.
2.	Trigger Cards: Provide 6 cards (name, description, example usage).
3.	Ethical Note: Add a caution for overuse.
4.	Testing Tip: Suggest 2 A/B ideas.
idealUseCase: Marketers brainstorming persuasive hooks for ads.

title: Prompt Kit: Sustainability Report Data Story Crafter
prompt:
You are a sustainability analyst. Turn ESG data into a narrative:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about data set, audience, and material topics.
2.	Story Outline: Write 3 sections (Progress, Challenges, Future Goals) with headline + bullet.
3.	Visual Ideas: Suggest 2 chart concepts.
4.	Call‑to‑Action: Provide 2 stakeholder engagement asks.
idealUseCase: ESG teams compiling annual sustainability reports.

title: Prompt Kit: Team Charter Workshop Leader
prompt:
You are a facilitation coach. Plan a 90‑minute team‑charter workshop:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about team maturity, remote/hybrid, and outcomes.
2.	Agenda: Icebreaker, Charter Canvas, Alignment Vote, Next Steps.
3.	Materials: List 4 materials (Miro board, timer, etc.).
4.	Follow‑up: Suggest 2 accountability tactics.
idealUseCase: New project teams aligning on norms and goals.

title: Prompt Kit: Testimonial Collection Campaign Planner
prompt:
You are a customer‑marketing manager. Plan a campaign to gather testimonials:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about segment, incentive, and channel.
2.	Campaign Steps: Outreach, Capture, Approve, Publish (with timelines).
3.	Question Bank: Provide 5 testimonial prompts.
4.	Utilization: Suggest 2 channels to showcase quotes.
idealUseCase: B2B companies refreshing social proof before launch.

title: Prompt Kit: Thought Leadership Whitepaper Outliner
prompt:
You are a B2B content strategist. Outline a 6‑page whitepaper:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about POV, target role, and unique data.
2.	Outline: Provide Title, Abstract, 4 Sections, Conclusion.
3.	Data Callout: Suggest 2 proprietary data angles.
4.	Promo Snippets: Craft 2 tweet‑length quotes.
idealUseCase: Consultancies positioning themselves as category experts.

title: Prompt Kit: Trade Show Traffic Builder
prompt:
You are an event marketer. Boost booth traffic at a trade show:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about show size, booth location, and budget.
2.	Tactics: List 5 tactics (pre‑show email, gamified scan, live demo, etc.).
3.	Giveaway Ideas: Suggest 3 thematic swag items.
4.	Lead Capture Metric: Recommend 2 tracking methods.
idealUseCase: Exhibitors maximizing ROI from booth spend.

title: Prompt Kit: Twitter Spaces Conversation Host Guide
prompt:
You are a social‑audio host. Prepare a Twitter Spaces session:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about topic, guest mix, and CTA.
2.	Run‑of‑Show: Intro, Topic Segments, Audience Q&A, Wrap.
3.	Hook Tweet: Provide 2 tweet examples.
4.	Repurposing: Suggest 2 post‑event content ideas.
idealUseCase: Community managers growing engagement via Spaces.

title: Prompt Kit: Upsell Timing Predictor
prompt:
You are a revenue‑ops analyst. Identify the best moment to upsell:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about lifecycle stage, usage pattern, and contract term.
2.	Signal List: Provide 5 behavioral signals.
3.	Scoring Formula: Outline a simple weighted model.
4.	Playbook: Suggest 2 outreach tactics when threshold met.
idealUseCase: Account managers increasing expansion revenue.

title: Prompt Kit: User Behavior Heatmap Interpreter
prompt:
You are a UX analyst. Turn heatmap findings into insights:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about page goal, device mix, and traffic source.
2.	Insight Table: List 3 hotspots with cause & recommendation.
3.	Quick‑Win Fix: Propose one copy/design tweak.
4.	Validation: Suggest 1 A/B follow‑up.
idealUseCase: Web teams prioritizing UX tweaks after Hotjar/Clarity runs.

title: Prompt Kit: Vertical Expansion Strategy Kit
prompt:
You are a go‑to‑market strategist. Plan expansion into a new vertical:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about TAM, competitive landscape, and regulation.
2.	Value Matrix: Map 3 pain points to product strengths.
3.	Landing Campaign: Outline 2 channels + messaging.
4.	Success Metric: Recommend 2 milestones for 6 months.
idealUseCase: Scale‑ups moving from horizontal to industry‑specific GTM.

title: Prompt Kit: Virtual Summit Run‑of‑Show Director
prompt:
You are a virtual‑events producer. Create a detailed run‑of‑show for a 1‑day summit:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about platform, attendee cap, and sponsor slots.
2.	ROS Table: List time, session, host, tech cue for each segment.
3.	Engagement Hooks: Suggest 3 interactive moments.
4.	Backup Plan: Provide 2 contingency actions.
idealUseCase: Marketing teams orchestrating multi‑session online summits.

title: Prompt Kit: Voice App Conversational Flow Designer
prompt:
You are a VUI designer. Draft a conversational flow for a voice skill:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about user intent, persona, and error tolerance.
2.	Flow Steps: Welcome, Task Prompt, Confirmation, Follow‑up (with sample utterances).
3.	Error Handling: Provide 2 graceful fallback lines.
4.	Persona Tone: List 3 tone adjectives.
idealUseCase: Teams prototyping Alexa/Assistant skills quickly.

title: Prompt Kit: Web Accessibility Statement Generator
prompt:
You are an accessibility advocate. Draft a site accessibility statement:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about compliance level, assistive tech testing, and feedback channel.
2.	Statement Sections: Commitment, Standards, Ongoing Effort, Feedback.
3.	Legal Note: Include one WCAG reference line.
4.	Next Review Date: Suggest cadence.
idealUseCase: Website owners publicizing their accessibility commitment.

title: Prompt Kit: Welcome Gift Unboxing Script
prompt:
You are a brand storyteller. Write a 60‑second unboxing narration for a welcome kit:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about gift items, brand tone, and channel.
2.	Script: Provide hook, item reveal sequence, heartfelt close.
3.	Hashtag Suggestions: Offer 2 branded hashtags.
4.	Share Prompt: Add one CTA for user‑generated content.
idealUseCase: D2C brands encouraging shareable unboxing videos.

title: Prompt Kit: Win‑Loss Interview Question Bank
prompt:
You are a competitive‑intel lead. Create a question bank for win‑loss calls:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about deal size, persona, and lost‑to competitor.
2.	Win Questions: Provide 5 probing questions.
3.	Loss Questions: Provide 5 probing questions.
4.	Coding Scheme: Suggest 3 theme codes for analysis.
idealUseCase: Revenue teams conducting structured win‑loss analysis.

title: Prompt Kit: Zero‑Party Data Capture Tactics Pack
prompt:
You are a retention marketer. List tactics to capture zero‑party data:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about channel stack, incentive, and privacy stance.
2.	Tactic List: Provide 5 tactics (quiz, preference center, etc.).
3.	Value Exchange: Add a benefit line for each.
4.	Compliance Tip: Include one GDPR/CCPA reminder.
idealUseCase: Brands personalizing without relying on third‑party cookies.

title: Prompt Kit: Product Sunset Communication Planner
prompt:
You are a product‑ops manager. Plan comms for sunsetting a legacy feature:
1.	Clarify: Ask up to 3 questions about user dependency, timeline, and migration path.
2.	Audience Matrix: Customers, Internal, Partners with channel & message.
3.	Timeline: Warning, Reminder, Deprecation (dates + action).
4.	Support FAQ: Draft 3 Q&As.
idealUseCase: Teams retiring features without harming trust.
